summary: The Choice in Automobile Retail Sales Act of 2025 aims to amend the Clean Air Act to prevent tailpipe regulations from restricting the availability of new motor vehicles. The bill prohibits regulations, including revisions made after January 1, 2021, from mandating specific technologies or limiting vehicle availability based on engine type. The Environmental Protection Agency is mandated to revise existing regulations within 24 months of the Act's enactment to align with the new provisions.
